chapter.title: Pengantar Xenta OS
chapter.para: Xenta OS adalah sistem operasi komputer yang dirancang untuk berjalan pada sebagian besar sistem modern, termasuk PC x86 dan x64 dan i386.

Xenta OS merupakan sistem operasi yang berjalan seperti Microsoft Windows, Apple Mac OS, dan OS BSD gratis. Xenta OS juga dirancang untuk bekerja bersama dengan sistem operasi lain (termasuk yang tercantum di atas), dan dapat secara otomatis mengatur dual boot atau multi-boot lingkungan (di mana pengguna diminta untuk memulai sistem operasi mana pada setiap boot-up) selama instalasi.
Xenta OS adalah sistem operasi yang bagus untuk individu dan perusahaan.

sect1.title: Sejarah
sect1.para: Xenta OS is a very modern operating system; Its development started in 2016. It is, however, built upon very mature and proven software layers, including the Linux kernel, the GNU tools and the &EDITION; desktop. It also relies on the Ubuntu and Debian projects and uses their systems as a base.

The Xenta OS project focuses on making the desktop more usable and more efficient for everyday tasks performed by regular users. Underneath the desktop the operating system also provides a huge collection of available software and a very well integrated set of services.
Xenta OS saw a rapid rise in popularity and more and more people use it every day.

sect1.title: Purpose
sect1.para: The purpose of Xenta OS is to provide a desktop operating system that home users and companies can use at no cost and which is as efficient, easy to use, and elegant as possible.

One of the ambitions of the Xenta OS project is to become the best operating system available by making it easy for people to get to use advanced technologies, rather than by simplifying them (and thereby reducing their capabilities), or by copying the approaches taken by other developers.

The goal is to develop our own idea of the ideal desktop. We think that it is best to make the most out of the modern technologies that exist under Linux and make it easy for everybody to use its most advanced features.

sect1.title: Version numbers and codenames
sect1.para: Version numbers and codenames follow a unique logic in Xenta OS:

listitem.para: Codenames provide a way to refer to versions of Xenta OS that is more familiar than using a version number.
Since version 5, Xenta OS has followed a 6 months release cycle and uses a simplified version scheme. The version number simply gets incremented every 6 months.
If revisions are made to a particular release (a bit like Service Packs in Windows) its version number gets a minor revision increment. For instance 3 becomes 3.1.
Codenames in Xenta OS are always female names ending with a. They follow the alphabetical order and the first letter of the codename corresponds to the index of the version number in the alphabet.

sect1.title: Where to find help
sect1.para: The Xenta OS community is very helpful and very active. If you have questions or a problem related to Xenta OS, you should be able to get help from other users online.
First, make sure to register with the Xenta OS. This is the very first place where you can find help: http://wwww.xentaos.com/.

If you want to chat with other users you can connect to the IRC chat room. Under Xenta OS simply launch Hexchat from the menu. If you’re using another operating system or another IRC client make sure to connect to the irc.spotchat.org server and to join the channels #xentaos.
